Bitcoin prices pushed lower on Thursday, November 20, extending recent losses as macro variables fueled weakness in the markets.

hypothesis_content.title: Weekend Liquidity Gap Amplification of News Flow
hypothesis_content.statement: Significant news (e.g., prediction-market lawsuit developments, geopolitical event) breaking during weekend Asian/European trading hours (Sat 00:00 – Sun 12:00 UTC) will cause an exaggerated price move in BTC (>2x typical intraday volatility) due to thin liquidity, which will partially reverse (>40% retracement) during US Sunday evening liquidity refresh.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Weekend markets have lower market maker presence and institutional participation. News-driven orders encounter shallower order books, creating oversized moves. As professional desks return Sunday evening (US), they provide liquidity and often fade exaggerated moves, especially if the news isn't fundamentally game-changing.
entry_conditions: Major crypto/ macro news headline occurs between Sat 00:00 and Sun 12:00 UTC
BTC price moves >3.5% within 2 hours of the news on spot exchanges
Aggregated spot volume across top 5 exchanges is <65% of the prior weekday average

exit_conditions.take_profit: 40-60% retracement of the initial weekend move by the 4-hour candle closing at 00:00 UTC Monday
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price continues in the initial direction, breaking the weekend high/low by another 1.5%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 00:00 UTC Monday (start of new trading week)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The weekend move sustains or accelerates into Sunday US hours with no retracement, indicating the news is fundamental enough to overcome liquidity effects.
